Description: Textile fragment made of two different pieces of undyed linen plain weave; one is applied above the other and sewn to it; on the lower fabric (a), at each 1cm, there are supplementary wefts in red wool (2 threads S, grouped together on 2 picks) these create a design of lines now mainly missing; one edge on the right has been hemmed on the external side with overstitiching in undyed linen; the edge at the top has been hemmed on the internal side with thread in undyed linen; the other edges are cut and ragged; the second fabric (b) has, at each 1.5cm, supplementary weft in bleached wool creating loops (c.1cm long); all the edges of this piece are cut and the fabric is sewn in different places with single linen threads; possibly a double faced curtain; plain weave (a): warp-undyed lien (S/15), weft-undyed linen (S/13), supplementary weft-red wool (S/paired); plain weave (b): warp-undyed linen (S/12), weft-undyed linen (S/10), supplemenatry weft loops-bleached wool (S/paired and twisted)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
